comments:
Dears,

I want to run a TestCase, but I got this error in log file:
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitLaunchConfiguration.addLibrariesFo
rDependents(JUnitLaunchConfiguration.java:266)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitLaunchConfiguration.createClassPat
h(JUnitLaunchConfiguration.java:227)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitLaunchConfiguration.createVMRunner
(JUnitLaunchConfiguration.java:65)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.launchType
s(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:203)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.launch
(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:180)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUIPlugin.java:731)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run
(DebugUIPlugin.java:929)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Does this help you?

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
org/eclipse/jdt/junit/runner/manipulators/TestManipulatorManager
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitLaunchConfiguration.createClassPat
h(JUnitLaunchConfiguration.java:194)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitLaunchConfiguration.createVMRunner
(JUnitLaunchConfiguration.java:65)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.launchType
s(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:203)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.launch
(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:180)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUIPlugin.java:731)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run
(DebugUIPlugin.java:929)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

I think it is related to plugin conflict between Eclipse-JUnit and 
ContinuouseTesting-JUnit, because I test the clean Eclipse and it works!!!

Masoud,

please report the bug against the provider of the ContinuouseTesting-JUnit since
this doesn't seem to be related to Eclipse JUnit. TestManipulatorManager isn't a
class that is provided by JUnit. IMO ContinuouseTesting-JUnit simply deliver new
classes in the same name space than JUnit, which they definitelly shouldn't do.

Dear Dirk,

There is a org.eclipse.jdt.junit.runtime_3.1.4.jar in the plugin package. Is 
it an Eclipse standard plugin? It contains both the following package:

\org\eclipse\jdt\internal\junit\runner
\org\eclipse\jdt\junit\runner\manipulators

But the old one (3.1.0 which exists in 3.1M6) only contains the first package. 
Off course they refer to new one in their feature.xml of the plugin: 

<plugin
         id="org.eclipse.jdt.junit.runtime"
         download-size="0"
         install-size="0"
         version="3.1.4"/>

org.eclipse.jdt.junit.runtime_3.1.4.jar isn't the official Eclipse junit.runtime
plug-in. The offical version doesn't contain a package
\org\eclipse\jdt\junit\runner\manipulators

There is a new version of CT(1.1.5), but it still has some serious problems.
David Saff has promised to solve all problems. Thanks David, we are looking for
your nice plugin. For more information refer to the following links.

New bug tracker:
http://pag.csail.mit.edu/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=378

Good news and promises:
http://lists.csail.mit.edu/pipermail/continuous-testing-plugin-discuss/2005-May/000052.html

To download CT new version:
http://pag.csail.mit.edu/continuoustesting/download.html
